subject: physics
title: Sound Waves and Speed of Sound MCQ Problems

problems.question: What type of wave is a sound wave?
problems.hint: Consider how particles in the medium move (compression/rarefaction).
problems.detailed: Sound waves are mechanical **longitudinal** waves: particles oscillate parallel to direction of propagation in compressions and rarefactions.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: Can sound waves travel through vacuum?
problems.hint: Sound is mechanical and requires a medium.
problems.detailed: Sound waves require a medium (air, water, solid) to propagate. They **cannot travel through a vacuum** because there are no particles to carry the compressions/rarefactions.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: Which formula relates speed \(v\), frequency \(f\), and wavelength \( \lambda \) for sound waves?
problems.hint: This is the general wave equation used for any wave type, including sound.
problems.detailed: The correct relation is \( v = f \lambda \): speed equals frequency times wavelength. This holds for sound waves.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: In which medium is the speed of sound highest, under typical conditions?
problems.hint: Recall the order given: solids > liquids > gases.
problems.detailed: Typically, sound travels fastest in solids, then liquids, then gases. Among your options, **water** is a liquid, so it’s faster than air (a gas).
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: What happens to the speed of sound in a gas as temperature increases?
problems.hint: Faster molecular motion means faster propagation.
problems.detailed: As temperature increases, molecules move more rapidly and transmit pressure variations more quickly, so the **speed of sound in a gas increases**.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov
